attributes.action: Remove the no smoking ban from mental health hospitals
attributes.background: I recently stayed in a mental health hospital and was unable to smoke. This is almost a form of torture. For 5 days i was unable to go out or go to a smoking area. People have enough stress while in hospital, there should be a smoking area where people can go to at least once an hour

attributes.action: Include tax exempt income in child maintenance payments.
attributes.background: Child maintenance payments do not include tax-exempt income. For example, a parent who was injured in war can receive thousands of pounds per month in tax-exempt pension. Of this they would only have to pay a few pounds per week to their child.
attributes.additional_details: How is it ok that the government remove financial responsibility for children when it can clearly be afforded?

attributes.action: Take freight off our roads and onto an improved Railway Freight system.
attributes.background: Governments worldwide are making great strides to protect the environment, yet the pioneers of Rail travel ignore the benefits of an updated Freight system that would take thousands of lorries and vans off UK roads and motorways. Saving Billions of pounds in road repairs and accidents.

attributes.action: Allow Petitions Calling for No Confidence in Ministers on petition.parliament.uk
attributes.background: Call government/parliament to allow petitions calling for a vote of No Confidence in Ministers/MPs due to the recent decision by the petitions committee not to accept/allow them. The decision should be made by the British public who politicians, parliament & the petitions committee are answerable to
attributes.additional_details: We live in a democratic country where the general public must have a voice that can be heard and taken into account.  Ministers and MPs must be accountable to the general public who should have the right to submit a petition for debate which people across the U.K. can support.  Some previous petitions calling for No Confidence have had over 100,000 signatures however only a few people in the petitions committee have decided not to allow them in the future

attributes.action: Stop charging for Vehicle Excise Duty
attributes.background:
The government wastes taxpayer money by collecting vehicle excise duty in the form of a tax on the car.
Instead the revenue currently generated through VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year £100 million worth of VED goes unpaid through evasion.
Car insurance and MOT details are now held on a central register so the outdated requirement to provide these documents when taxing a car is un-necesaary. 
VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold, this would create a simple and unavoidable way of collecting the revenue. It would also encourage people to buy fuel efficient cars therefore helping the environment.

attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in Children's Homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013) on average £133,000 - £148,000 per child per year, yet it will cost a parent approximately £25,000 - £30,000 per year to send their child to a top boarding school to receive the best education money can buy, and those that attend boarding school don’t end up in prison. This is one of many viable solutions to consider

attributes.action: To make it a legal human right for every UK citizen to have a home.
attributes.background: Homelessness is increasing, human beings should not be living on the streets in the 21st Century. The United Kingdom is a first world country and as a civilised advanced country we should no longer tolerate homelessness for any reason.

attributes.action: Mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display the dangers of alcohol when pregnant
attributes.background: To help prevent foetal alcohol in children and raise awareness

attributes.action: Ban LED vehicle headlights
attributes.background: These new LED headlights are horrendous for drivers with any kind of light sensitivity, and probably not great for anyone. I literally put my hand in front of my eyes when a car with these lights approach. Instinctive reflex to protect my eyes, highly dangerous when driving!  Normal headlights fine.

attributes.action: Armed Forces Veterans should be entitled to concessionary rail travel.
attributes.background: Should have the same entitlement to discounted rail travel as serving members.
attributes.additional_details: As a Royal Navy veteran (23 years under the waves) I feel it unfair that there is no mechanism in place to obtain a railcard other than the normal route, ie Family & Friends, Disability, 16-25 or wait until I reach 60. Serving our country is an honour and requires a massive commitment for many years, so I do not feel it is too much to ask for a small token to help with travel costs, especially when none of the other cards are valid for the lone, uninjured, pre-State Pension Veteran traveller.

attributes.action: Introduce compensation  for misleading people to buy diesel cars
attributes.background: We were told to buy diesel cars a few years ago and now we are being told to buy electric cars. If you have a diesel car you have to pay to enter into London when the government were the ones who told us to get diesel cars as they are better. I think we should get money from the government for this
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should get compensation for this as we were told to buy diesel cars and now we have to pay extra for someone's mistake

attributes.action: Make prostitution legal in order to make sex workers safe and keep them healthy.
attributes.background: For our citizenship GCSE qualification, we must choose an issue that we believe needs attention, and should be discussed as many people are being affected by the stigma on sex workers.This affects their health and safety as they are scared to be tested for STIs or report cases such as rape or abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Before creating this petition, we did research on both the advantages and disadvantages of legalizing prostitution and how it would affect people. We also conducted primary research and gave out a questionnaire in school asking teachers their opinion on the issue and explaining how people, especially sex workers, would benefit if it were legal. 61% of the teachers agreed that it should be legalized before we told them the advantages and disadvantages, and 75% agreed after learning the benefits.

attributes.action: Give tax breaks to parents who support their children through university
attributes.background:
I am supporting my daughter through university. 
Why not treat these payments in the same way as gift aid? , reimburse my daughter the 20% tax on the value that I've paid to her?

attributes.action: Set up a UK Sovereign Wealth Fund
attributes.background:
The shale gas industry could give the UK an opportunity to do things better this time and put those funds aside for future generations.

Rather than investing in Gilts - pension companies should encourage investment in this fund to be used for major infrastructure  opportunities.
attributes.additional_details: Instead of squandering future revenue from this initiative like we did with oil in the 1970’s - invest the lot and build up a capital sterling reserve.

attributes.action: Lower the price of road tax for petrol and increase the price for diesel
attributes.background: It is said that Diesel cars emit more harmful pollutants, why should road tax be so much cheaper for diesel? it only encourages more people to use diesel.

attributes.action: Same sex married couples should be able to divorce on grounds of adultery
attributes.background: When the UK Government welcomed same sex marriage and updated the Marriage Act accordingly, they neglected to sufficiently update the divorce law. We are now living in a country where same sex couples cannot divorce under the grounds of adultery. Where is the equality? Equal rights for all.
attributes.additional_details: Adultery is not legally recognised as grounds for marriage dissolution in the UK. The message this sends out is that the laws will selectively discriminate. It also shows a lack of foresight and planning - always check your dependencies (cause and effect of law changes).

attributes.action: Replace credit card commission to businesses with flat fees per transaction
attributes.background: The government announced recently that businesses are no longer able to charge commission on credit card payments. However, credit card companies can still levy commission on businesses. This is damaging to many businesses, especially as commissions vary, so we must introduce fixed fees instead.
attributes.additional_details:
More people will use a credit card rather than a debit card now there is no commission to pay. This is to be expected, after all, the money is better in their account for a month, but the cost to business is unjust.
The cost for debit card transactions is around 15p per transaction. 
For £100,000 worth of transactions at an average of £50, this would equate to £300. 
For credit cards this could be between £1,500 and £2,000. There is no justification for such excess so please help to stop it.

attributes.action: Referenda enacted by a UK nation must allow citizens born in that nation a vote.
attributes.background: If a UK nation considers a referendum about independence from the union, or a related topic that affects the stability of that union, then voters born in that nation, and who are citizens of the UK residing within the UK, must be able to vote on the referendum topic.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Independence Referendum of 2014 refused the vote to citizens of the UK born in Scotland, but who resided in another nation of the UK. Since this would likely impact their citizenship (stateless?) and ability to work, they should be able to vote.

This is a general petition, and is not specific to a future Scottish Referendum. Any citizen of the UK, born in a UK nation (Northern Ireland, Wales, Scotland, England) where their birth-Nation has a referendum, should be able to vote.

attributes.action: Stop employers referring to contracted hours employment as a "minimum".
attributes.background: In many contracts, (especially in retail), the hours expected for an employee to work are stated as a "minimum". This wording, in effect, allows the employer to require you to work above your minimum working hours without having to pay you overtime.
attributes.additional_details: The wording of all employment contracts should be absolutely clear as to the expected working hours of the employment. There should be no ambiguity to allow the employer to achieve "free labour" from the technical wording of their contract. If an employer requires an employee to work hours in excess of their contract, this should be reimbursed through overtime payments.

attributes.action: Make road cycling safer by introducing a law to enforce reflective clothing.
attributes.background: I am a cyclist and a motorist, but i feel strongly that too many cyclists are not aware that they are not visible in dark clothing. By introducing a law, we can help cut down road traffic accidents involving cyclists and improve their general safety.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I are members of Catford Cycling Club - which is one of the oldest in the U.K. We have been cycling many years. I regularly have to make cyclists aware that they are not visible on the road.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the old National Curriculum sub‐divided level grading system
attributes.background: From September 2014, the Government made huge changes in the way that students were to be assessed. This was a new way of thinking for schools, looking very different to the previous 20 years. These changes have created confusion among students and parents while decreasing student motivation.
attributes.additional_details: With the old grading system, there was little a correlation between a level and a child’s year group, and this can be seen in the way that in a Year 6 class there could be a range of levels, from level 2 to a level 6. However, the new National Curriculum sets out a mark scheme of a simple emerging, developing, secure, mastery.

attributes.action: Employers’ Education Tax to contribute towards university tuition fee costs
attributes.background:
Employers currently receive the rewards of a highly educated workforce but contribute little or nothing towards the educational costs of their employees.
Employers should pay a 1% tax rate on the gross salary of all employees to help fund the tuition fee costs of all students entering university.
attributes.additional_details:
The new 1% Employers Education Tax will go towards eliminating the tuition fee liability on all existing UK graduates and providing free university tuition fee for all current and future UK students leaving further education.
In addition, individuals who may have missed the opportunity to go to university and who may now, or in the future, wish to pursue a university degree for whatever purpose will be encouraged to apply at all stages of their life and be funded to do so.

attributes.action: Stop Parliamentary recess for Party Annual Conferences
attributes.background: I passionately believe the Parliament of the United Kingdom fails to serve the country efficiently as it is 'closed' too often and for excessive periods. If Party Conferences are necessary they should be held during summer recess or another recess period.

attributes.action: Add a coat of arms to the Union Flag, to better represent all nations of the U.K
attributes.background: Though iconic, the flag's design doesn't represent all of the United Kingdom. There is historical context for the omission of Wales, but if we truly are a Union of four countries, we need to show that to the world. Adding a coat of arms with four national symbols would be small, but significant.
attributes.additional_details:
In these times, the importance of the Union has been highlighted by figures across the political spectrum. 

Adding a small coat of arms to the Union Flag comprising of four symbols for each of the nations (Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland and England), would not change the issues the Union faces. But it might help restore confidence, and finally give Wales visual representation. 

It would be seen internationally, as well. A reminder, to us and to the world, that we are four nations - united.

attributes.action: change workplace drugs tests. Oral mouth swabs should be the compulsory method.
attributes.background: Urine based testing is a demeaning and very personal method of testing. Oral mouth swabs is a easy and non-invasive method. It is the method used by police for road users and should be made the compulsory method for the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: Oral mouth swabs has the ability to detect drug use within the first few hours. This is a window of time that is omitted by urine tests. Mouth swabs, with their ability to detect drug use 1-4 days after use, are the best method for impairment and post-accident testing.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all non-recyclable packaging materials by 31st December 2020.
attributes.background:
It's crazy that we are still buying products with mixed packaging materials where part of it is recyclable and part of it not. 
I believe this means we recycle significantly less than we could as some people do not bother to sort it and just throw everything into the general rubbish.
attributes.additional_details: The need to reduce the use of landfill and to increase recycling is widely accepted and I believe this would be a major step forward to making a greener more sustainable future for our country and the world

attributes.action: Ban the use of domestic Wood Burning Stoves to improve air quality for all
attributes.background: Wood burning stoves are becoming more and more common which is evidenced by the tangible and demonstrable drop in air quality in recent years. You do not need any scientific equipment to witness the drop in quality. Just step outside on any cold day or night and you will smell the foul acrid smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Breathing clean, unpolluted, fresh smelling air should be a basic human right, but yet in modern Britain it is not as people are permitted to set fire to wood in order to create heat, which is completely unnecessary in 2018. Household wood burners should be banned immediately before more people are duped into buying them under the green banner and releasing more harmful particulates into the air. It is a shame to think that breathing clean fresh crisp winter air is currently a thing of the past.

attributes.action: To have a UK referendum on the colour of the UKGB passport post Brexit.
attributes.background: The government has announced that the UK will be returning to a navy blue passport post Brexit. As Brexit is about building a new future, a return to its navy origins can be considered looking backwards. There should be a choice of colours for people to choose from to represent this new beginning.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_wheel

attributes.action: Make employers specify a minimum salary on all job adverts
attributes.background: UK average salary increases insufficient as living costs continue to rise sharply. Job seekers deserve transparency. Companies offering 'competitive' salaries complicate the process of finding employment and hinder job seekers from comparing potential income and making an informed choice.
attributes.additional_details:
If companies are forced to advertise a minimum salary it becomes easier for a job seeker to determine the suitability of a certain position. It cuts the inefficiency of time and money spent on applications with no hope of employment and helps to ensure employers can't widen already established pay gaps, offer job seekers a deserved level of clarify and transparency.

https://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/earningsandworkinghours

attributes.action: Televise Government lobby briefings
attributes.background: With trust in both politicians and the mainstream media at an all time low,  government lobby briefings should be televised to demonstrate a true record of what has taken place.
attributes.additional_details: The public are sceptical that lobby briefings as reported are a true reflection of the exchanges, as can be seen from the White House press briefings, what is said is available for anyone to view impartially without media bias.

attributes.action: Persistent drunk drivers with 3 or more should be banned from driving for life.
attributes.background: Norfolk Police have arrested 57 people in 9 days for driving over the limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are repeat drink driving offenders.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-24281043

Too many persistent offenders serve a short ban and are then able to reapply for their licences. For those who are clearly never going to learn we need the ultimate sanction. Fines and imprisonment are not enough. A lifetime driving ban will keep the roads safe for the vast majoriry of sensible drivers.

attributes.action: Retest EVERY driver every 10 years when photo card licence needs to be renewed.
attributes.background:
Currently, driving licences last until the holder reaches 70 years, but the photograph on their licence must be updated every 10 years. 
As an Approved Driving Instructor (ADI) I have to be re-tested every so-often to prove that I am "up to standard". Why not apply the same rule to all drivers?
attributes.additional_details: Driving licence photos must be renewed every 10 years. MANY drivers say "I couldn't pass my test again". We (ADI's) are required to teach "safe driving for life". Rules change. Signs change. Road layouts change. Change the licence requirements. DVSA could call the renewing licence holder for a "check" free of charge. If the licence holder passes their check DVLA will issue a renewed licence. If the holder fails the check their licence would be suspended until they pay for each check and pass.

attributes.action: The UK stays in the customs union as part of the Brexit process.
attributes.background: The UK is a trading nation and free movement of our goods within the EU is critical. Being a member does not prevent the UK from trading with other countries - we do so now. It simply means that tariffs have to be paid in certain circumstances. It would also solve the Ireland impasse at stroke.
attributes.additional_details: Most MPs support the customs union being retained but Brexiteers want it removed in order to enable this country to negotiate trade deals with other countries. Not having a trade deal does not prevent members of the union from trading with other countries. Germany for example trades a great deal with China as we do with the USA. Tariffs have to be paid in some circumstances but that does not stop trading.

attributes.action: Make time to debate and vote on Jim McMahon's 'Votes at 16' bill in the Commons.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to make time for the House of Commons to debate and vote on Jim McMahon MP's 'Votes at 16' bill.
attributes.additional_details:
Earlier this month Jim McMahon, the Member of Parliament for Oldham West and Royton, introduced a bill to lower the Voting Age to 16. MPs who didn’t support the Bill exploited an old House of Commons rule that means that Bills that are still being debated on a Friday afternoon at 2:30pm aren’t automatically voted on. This makes it very hard for them to become law. This is not just undemocratic, this is indefensible!

http://metro.co.uk/2017/11/03/tory-mps-accused-of-filibustering-to-block-bill-lowering-the-voting-age-to-16-7052134/
https://www.parliament.uk/biographies/commons/jim-mcmahon/4569
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-41862264

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: Stop councils having to pay when planning decisions are overturned on appeal
attributes.background: Having spoken to local councillors it would appear the councils are becoming unwilling to deny planning because of the costs involved if overturned at appeal. This needs to stop or will end up with councils unwilling to do their best for the people, purely based on money.
attributes.additional_details: I feel the need to ask this question having been witness to the completely inappropriate and ill advised project to double the size of a small village in North Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Increase School Funding to local authorities and Stop the Education Cuts.
attributes.background: Over the last two years schools have been forced to reduce the number of school support staff owing to unprecedented cuts in the Government support grant.Those taking the hardest cuts are school support staff who are either made redundant or have to do more by having extra duties without recognition
attributes.additional_details:
Schools should have more than the current funding settlement and the freedom to employ the right level of support staff appropriate to the needs of their pupils with the drive to improve education standards.
They are the backbone of our education system and should be treated with respect. They help the most vulnerable children and schools cannot function without them. As a consequence, many children would struggle and leave school without the qualifications and skills needed in adulthood.

attributes.action: Rebate and partially rebate stamp duty on properties purchased since 22/11/16
attributes.background: The new stamp duty rules for houses under 300k and only partial for above is great news for new buyers. I was a new buyer 5 months ago and struggled to get stamp duty together.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that following the chancellor’s revelation on the 22/11/17, all properties purchased within the last 12 months, particularly ones purchased using help to buy, should have partial or full refunds on the stamp duty in line with the chancellor’s new ruled surrounding stamp duty

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Homes under £300000 for all buyers
attributes.background: Why only abolish stamp duty on houses under £300000 for first time buyers as a lot of families moving home would benefit from this too. Most first time buyers won’t benefit as much as families upsizing their house and the saving would incentify buying

attributes.action: Ban vans parking and blocking views of crossings&driveways
attributes.background: Van drivers don’t realise that parking where they do can cause view of drivers pulling off of driveways and people waiting to cross and bus stops etc

attributes.action: Ban (Prospective) Employers asking about salary history from job applicants
attributes.background: Law makers say asking about salary history continues the cycle of pay inequality and makes it harder for people to change careers/jobs. The salary question is a hidden,yet,pervasive form of discrimination. It enables employers to use potential employee's past salary to determine the salary to offer.
attributes.additional_details:
Some states in the U.S (e.g. New York city) has already passed the law (in 2017) prohibiting employers to ask about salary history in interviews or on applications.
By banning the question during the hiring process, employers will be required to offer jobs and compensation to prospective employees based on their own skills, merit and demands of the job, not gender, race or ethnicity.
Banning salary history question is the next step to take in the fight to end the pay gap.

attributes.action: Change and restrict the dates for sale of fireworks around bonfire night.
attributes.background: We all know that bans do not work, we all know that bonfire night isn't going anywhere, but did you know that the sale of fireworks around bonfire night starts from the 15th of October to the 8th of November that's 25 days of sale. Potentially 4 weeks of fireworks going off in any one area.
attributes.additional_details:
There are members of the public who are not sensible and continuously break the law, setting off fireworks in proximity to peoples homes and even terrorising and subjecting abuse to other members of the public for up to the whole 4 weeks of sale. Unfortunately animals are also very easily abused with fireworks too, many incidents include tieing them to animals and setting them off.
I call to get the sale dates changed and restricted to less than 14 days around the time of bonfire night.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates and replace with business rates transaction charge
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  These disproportionate business rates are contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% business rates charge levied on the sales value of each transaction would be a fair arrangement and would be linked directly to the success of a retail business. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place.  The credit card holder’s physical location or credit card address is readily available for government’s re-distribution to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Protect private companies and pension funds by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees.  However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered. 

Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.

Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company.

attributes.action: Cut the overseas budget
attributes.background: The Prime Minster Should and must cut the overseas budget by 75% and spend the money on rectifying our countries finacial parlous position, and stop the ever continuing cuts.

attributes.action: Make private ownership of reptiles and amphibians a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Three quarters of all pet reptiles dies within a year, that is around six millions animals. Having reptiles and amphibians as pets is cruel because they suffer in captivity and cannot be looked after properly.

attributes.action: Fine* patients who do not attend (DNA) NHS hospital appointments.
attributes.background:
DNAs: 
- Cost the NHS an estimated £225 million in 2012 to 2013° 
- Result in extended waiting lists 
- Are an inefficient use of staff 
- Occurred in around 5.6 million (9% of the total) NHS outpatient appointments in England between 2014 to 2015°° 
(See additional details for sources °and°°)
attributes.additional_details:
Appointments where a patient does not show or provide prior notice are regarded as DNAs (did not attend). 
*To reduce DNAs, provide an incentive from as little as a £1 circumstantial charge to encourage patients to cancel. Thus freeing a space for those who can attend the appointment.
°Source: The National Audit Office 
°°Source: Quarterly Hospital Activity Data, 2015
Additional information:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hospitals-and-patients-urged-to-take-action-on-missed-appointments

attributes.action: Digital Software libraries should be considered to be assets.
attributes.background: Digital Software is everywhere in today's world, this why the UK should be the first country to consider any form of digital software to an asset to the purchaser of that digital software whether it being Operating Systems, Video Games, Music & General Digital Software.
attributes.additional_details:
It has recently come about thanks to video game journalist Chris Bratt that digital software libraries are not considered to be assets and can not be transferred to a loved one if you sadly pass away. Furthermore, when you do sadly pass away these digital libraries of software get deleted wiping all monetary value from them as the terms of service are no longer valid.  

For further information watch Chris Bratt video here.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kHLFUbU5ceI

attributes.action: Make Legal Provision for Northwest Regions of the UK to hold a Legal Referendum.
attributes.background: The referendum will give all citizens in the North a chance to vote on uniting UK Northern Regions to form an autonomous independent country breaking away from the South & the UK Government with Manchester as a Northern Capital with an elected Minister best placed to serve the citizens of N/England.
attributes.additional_details: Northern citizens suffer from lower life expectancy, lack of investment in areas such as education, health, skilled training and quality employment opportunities. Lack of political influence in London/South effects the Norths capability for economic growth. The neglect in these  areas is at such an extent that the North & South could be viewed as separate countries already. (One Example) IPPR thinktank, DT infrastructure spending 2016/17 London £1,943 per person, Northwest Region £680pp.
